Reviews.Title: “Good place for reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Tanitka
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. We looked for not very expensive B&B to spend a weekend in Berlin. The room was nice, breakfast was simple but adequate. Staff speaks German, Russian and very little English. This pension is located in Charlottenburg district about 15 minutes walking from U-bahn station. But there is a bus-stop just 100 meters away and we used buses to go to Zoo (S- and U-Bahn) station. There are 2 supermarkets in front of the hotel, many restaurants and shopping street in 2 blocks. I can recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Judi M
Reviews.Content: This Pension took my booking in the spring and there started a complete nightmare. The hotel is dreadful, rooms are dirty, service non-existent and they refuse cancellations. Friends of mine who were joining the party wished to cancel their reservations once they learned what a dreadful hotel is was and were refused any refund and simply lost all their money. This place should be reported to the authorities as I cannot believe their behaviour is in accordance with the rules laid down for hotel operators. We were a large group in Berlin and when I saw what fellow travellers' had for the same money I paid for a small, filthy room I was very disappointed. The pictures on the net are EXTREMELY misleading.

Reviews.Title: “cheap”
Reviews.Author: Terence C
Reviews.Content: I spent some time in this hotel, when I stayed in Berlin during a huge exhibition. It was really difficult to find any free rooms in Berlin, expecially close to the exhibition. It was a releif, when I found this pension, where we had a inexpensive room for some nights. I remember, that I did not have any problem with heating or hot water. But I also remember that the doors were not proper and we could enjoy the smoke comming from our next door neighboor.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and value for money”
Reviews.Author: gens1980
Reviews.Content: Cheap and friendly. This hotel is well located, next to Schloss Charlottenburg (which is really worth the trip). The room was big and clean, though a bit noisy. The breakfast was easy but good. Last, the hotel kept my luggage all day long after the checkout in a safe place (they even checked my room number when I came back to pick it up, which I found really good).

Reviews.Title: “good choice for walk-in guests, good rates”
Reviews.Author: fab10lau
Reviews.Content: I staid only one night but I found friendly and helpful staff, even if some of them did not speak english at all. The hotel is ok but nothing special, located in a building shared with few private houses, in the west part of Berlin, and in my opinion, in the best district of Berlin - Charlottenburg. Underground station is nearby, walking distance. The breakfast is good and with wide choice in terms of what does the room costs. The room was pretty warm, even without turning on the heating, thing which I appreciated given the averages Berlin temperatures.

Reviews.Title: “THAT'S GREAT”
Reviews.Author: ShimShim30
Reviews.Content: Remaining in this hotel was one of my best experience and I enjoyed it very much.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Calm, Oldish Style, valuable as an one star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PePa23
Reviews.Content: I travelled 6 Europe countries this year with my wife and I have little time for booking a hotel in Berlin. I was confused and despaired of finding a suitable place for stay. I needed a calm, clean, priceless, and with good location. Thank God that I saw this hotel in the website and I choosed it. When we arrived with my wife and my son-in-law; we shocked a little. We thought that we wasted our money. But when we went inside, checked in and arrived at their room, the atmosphere absorbed us and took us to grandmother's memories. Hotel is calm, clean, old stylish and etc. I liked it. It is a little far from City center but have good availability to public transportation. We had good time and memories here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience, Recomended”
Reviews.Author: Alialexie
Reviews.Content: Well, we were 3 and looking for a cheap place, last minute we found here but we we reched there it was unexpectedly clean, cozy and worth for money. Breakfast was really good, bathrooms renovated and comfortable beds. Hotel brought us a nostalgic feeling and reminding granndma home, we really enjoyed it and definitely recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean, safe, calm atmosphere, better than one star but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Johnchivers
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 12 days recently to attend the World Athletics Championships at the Olympic Stadium which is 2 1/2 miles away. Found the place to be much better than I thought it might be. The hotel occupies the second, third, and fourth floors of a 5 storey building which is part of a wider block and fronted by a busy road with 3 lanes of traffic in each direction but not too noisy, especially at night ( though I did wear earplugs ). Just behind the hotel is a nice medium sized park with a lake at its centre and sunbathers, dog walkers, and joggers. The transfer to the hotel is fairly easy from Tegel airport- just catch Bus 109 for 2 Euros and ten cents which runs every 10 minutes each way until the early hours and takes about 15 minutes and get off at Kanstrasse and walk along Kanstrasse for 5 minutes until you come to Neuekanstrasse and the hotel is at No. 5. Arrival at Tegel airport to the hotel door took only 70 minutes, with baggage being exceptionally quick and the plane parking up before that in about only 2 minutes. The single room I occupied was very small but quite comfortable with a single bed, tv with 14 channels ( all in German ), bedside cabinet, wardrobe with plenty of hangers, chair, small table, large modern sink in the corner with instant hot water from the tap ; there was also a large central heating radiator on the wall. The room had a large, tall window which opened fully inwards which made up for the fact there is no air conditioning- this was not needed in the room, despite the hot weather. There was no tea or coffee making facilities in the room and no phone. Sheets and used towels were changed every day and the room cleaned at about 1pm- a bit of a nuisance as about that time I would be arriving back from the Olympic Stadium after the morning session of the athletics. The room came with a private bathroom in the corridor- this was large and cool with a good shower but I was not convinced it was private as there was no lock on the door and on at leat one occasion another person used it. I raised this with the manager ( a Russian bloke ) but I did not get anywhere. I did not mind sharing the bathroom if that was what was going on- but a shared bathroom meant I was paying about 90 Euros too much for the room over the 12 days which I was not happy about. The included breakfast in the fairly small but never overcrowded breakfast room was good : choice of 4 cereals, pots of yoghurts, fruit cocktail from a bowl ( the sort you get in tins ), 2 fruit juices, sliced meats and sliced cheeses, warm boiled eggs, 3 types of bread, no toast, a sweet bread , tea and coffee, and served between 8 and 10am. No air conditioning in this room ( or anywhere in the hotel ) but it was not needed despite the hot weather. There are windows in the braekfast room which were usually open and it was quite pleasant. The staff at the hotel were all older and mature and you did not see much of them after breakfast- save for the cleaners. Most of the time there is no one at the small reception counter in the corridor outside the breakfast room but if you ring a bell someone will appear. The reception closes at 11pm so If you are going to arrive after that time let them know as they have a procedure for dealing with this. I liked the fact that the staff were largely not to be seen- this felt more relaxing and free and there were no shenanigans going on in their absence ( I think some of them may live in the hotel on the first floor, though I am not sure ). You have to pay in advance on arrival at the hotel and they do ask for payment in cash though they said they would accept a accept a credit card if you did not have the cash . You receive one key which both enables you to access the building and your room. I was not required to pay a key deposit. I did not see any internet facilities at the hotel. Opposite the hotel there is a supermarket with a good choice of foods to buy and useful for getting water and the like ( they charge 25cents extra for each bottle of water and you get that bank when you return the bottle )- I wouldn't recommend the tap water at the hotel for drinking- it certainly did not agree with me... Near the hotel there are plenty of small restaurants and other places to eat. The nearest tube station ( U Bahn ) is Sophie Charlotte Place -a leisurely 5 minutes walk, turn left out of the hotel and ten yards away take the first left again and just walk to the top of this road - where the U2 line runs ( it is only 4 stops to the Olympic Stadium, hotel to stadium just 18 minutes ). Opposite this tube station there is a useful internet cafe which charges 50cents for 30 minutes, one Euro for an hour. If you stay at the hotel, I would suggest avoiding the first floor of the hotel ( 2nd floor of building itself ) as this is where the reception and breakfast room is and you would have a lot more noise to put up with and possibly less privacy, especially in the morning ( I stayed in the floor above so did not experience this ). People from many different countries were staying at the hotel ( possibly partly explained by people staying to attend the athletics ) - I am not sure there were any any other Brits, though. The people ranged from younger couples to families with young children and they all behaved impeccably. All in all, this is advertised as a one star hotel but it is really much better than that. That said, I paid about £33 for each night and I still think that was overpriced. I would recommend this hotel if you need to saty in this are of Berlin. I chose it to make it easier to attend the athletics and, in that regard, it was a very good choice. John.

Reviews.Title: “Preis/Leistung OK”
Reviews.Author: KocirJure
Reviews.Content: Close to a Busstation, next to a nice Bar - good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly, basic Berlin hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sapengro
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for. We didn't pay much we didn't get much. Four of us crammed into a dirty room, squeaky floorboards, squeaky receptionist who I think has never cracked a smile. After booking, charged extra for toilet. This is a basic hotel, just for putting your head down. Carefully.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location!”
Reviews.Author: Mooches
Reviews.Content: This place is not swanky or in any way luxurious, however it is very good value for money. It is basic and a little old fashioned in decor etc but it is clean, the staff are extremely friendly and helpful and the breakfast is great. There are two properties owned by hotel Messe, the pension and the hotel. We stayed in the hotel for 4 nights over New Year and it was great. We had an on-suite bathroom which had a good shower. The room was spacious and clean. The hotel is literally right next to the Messe Nord S bahn station and a 5 min walk from the Kaiserdam U Bahn station which is great for getting into town and home again at any time of day or night... very regular services! You are expected to pay before you get the key so have cash ready as the card machine wasn't working when we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Allright”
Reviews.Author: jikany
Reviews.Content: I read a couple of negative reviews on this hotel, so I didn't expect any good. But it really wasn't as bad as I thought it would be. The rooms were clean, like the toilet and bathroom. Yes, the hotel is budget-like, but they don't pretend to be anything else, so if you're surprised your room doesn't have a toilet, it's not their fault, you should have checked the facilities offered better. The staff is friendly, though they only speak German, so take your phrasebook with you if you don't. We got an extra breakfast on the day of arrival (because we were early), and some leftovers the day we left. We could leave our luggage in the hotel at the day of departure, so we didn't have to carry it around Berlin during the day. So, just be nice to the staff, try to speak a little German, and your stay will be alright.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: 6SHARON66
Reviews.Content: Breakfast is the ONLY redeeming feature of this place. It smells of boiled cabbage and cigarettes, even on the non-smoking floors. You must pay cash upfront before you are given your key. If you have a shower in your room, it is in the corner and has no screen around it. Frankly, it was dissapointing experience alround. The location was okay, nice and close the Schloss Charlottenburg, but doesn't overlook a lake, it is on a busy road. Really, the photos don't show how grimey it is, and it looks like it could do with a big spring clean. Still, if you want to go budget and are happy to share the one toilet on the floor with a dodgey lock, this is the place to be! Make sure you eat your money's worth at breakfast, you wont get it anywhere else. One star rating is probably half a star too many.

HotelInfo.Name: Pension Messe
HotelInfo.Address: Neue Kantstrasse 5, 14057 Berlin, Germany
